data.question: What is the formula of the large protonated water cluster trapped in the 3D metal-organic framework?
Which metal and ligand form the 3D metal-organic framework?
What is the role of the [PW12O40]3- anion in the synthesis of the compound?
data.answer: It acts as a template for the formation of the 3D metal-organic framework.

data.question: How many water molecules form the shell of the protonated water cluster?
What is the symmetry of the (H2O)26 shell?
What model is suggested for the monowater core within the center of the protonated water cluster?
data.answer: Eigen model of a hydronium ion

data.question: What is the main advantage of using water clusters for studying protonated water?
data.answer: They allow obtaining precise structural data of hydrogen-bonded simulations in diverse environments.

data.question: Why are crystallographic structural studies preferred over spectroscopic investigations for large proton hydrate clusters?
data.answer: Because they provide much more detailed information characterizing the clusters.

data.question: What stabilizes the water clusters in the framework?
data.answer: Twelve acetonitrile molecules acting as pillars through hydrogen bonds.

data.question: What is the role of acetonitrile molecules in the structure?
data.answer: They link the water molecules with the heavy 'building stones' [PW12O40]3- anions.

data.question: Is the proton in the water cluster located on the interior or the surfaces of the water shell?
data.answer: It is not clear from the X-ray structure.

data.question: What does the conformation calculation suggest about the position of the excess proton?
data.answer: It suggests that the excess proton resides inside the clathrate structure.

data.question: True or False: The protonated water cluster H+(H2O)27 is stabilized outside the cavities of the 3D metal-organic framework.
True or False: The cubic cavities of the framework are solely occupied by [PW12O40]3- anions.
True or False: The water cluster within the framework is composed of a (H2O)26 shell and a monowater core.
True or False: The protonation of the surfaces of a Keggin structure [PW12O40]3- anion is possible under the crystallization conditions described.
True or False: All cavities in the framework are filled by the anions.
True or False: The excess proton in the water cluster is positioned on the surface of the water shell.
True or False: The Eigen model suggests the excess proton is positioned in the center of the water cluster.
